intro: Wahlenbergia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Wahlenbergia hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and attractive flowers.
